subject: Negotiation
title: The Fyre Festival Fraud
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Fyre Festival Fraud.

hook.text: Billy McFarland sold luxury festival tickets on Instagram hype alone. Guests arrived to disaster tents and cheese sandwiches.

buildup.text: McFarland negotiated vendor deals, celebrity endorsements, and ticket sales with money he didn't have.

discovery.text: Every negotiation was built on lies â€” fake budgets, fake promises, and fake timelines.

twist.text: McFarland was sentenced to six years in prison. Partners and vendors were left with millions in unpaid bills.

climax.text: Negotiations built entirely on deception don't just fail â€” they become criminal cases.

punchline.text: You can fake a deal. You can't fake delivery.

quiz.question: What made Fyre Festival a negotiation disaster?
options: Every deal was built on lies, fake budgets, and promises that couldn't be kept
